Chief Obafemi Awolowo

The president we never had.

Chief Obafemi Awolowo, played a major role in the constitutional conferences in London and Lagos that paved the way for independence, having served as Premier of the self-governing Western region from 1954 until Nigeria achieved full independence from Britain in 1960.

Below we have a brief history of Chief Obafemi Awolowo's life:

Chief Obafemi Jeremiah Oyeniyi Awolowo (6 March 1909 – 9 May 1987) was a nationalist and a statesman who played a key role in Nigeria’s independence movement. He is most notable as the outstanding first premier of the Western Region but was also a successful federal commissioner for finance and vice president of the Federal Executive Council in the Civil War.

For more on this great hero , please visit his Wikipedia entry
